reviews.text: Great collection! Fabulous items, however there's few katana swords
I havent been to the museum, but the park of that museum is my favourite place in Genova. It has a beautiful waterfall

I had visited their official website and don't remember reading anything relevant to not accepting credit card for ticket purchase. I was denied entrance, since I didn't had any cash with me at that time. 

The woman there showed me a sign written in Italian, that mentioned the credit card denial. However, if you don't know Italian, then you can now know that, not that it would help, but just saying.

A great museum with stunning artifacts but if you're English speaking and interested in the historical background there is very little information and context available for English speaking visitors. Which was disappointing.

Wonderful museum that contains a huge collection of Japanese art objects and historical objects (swords, armours...). Very interesting. You have to enter from the "Valletta Di Negro" park  (Piazza Corvetto)
Красивый ухоженный парк у виллы. Прекрасные виды на море, особенно в солнечную погоду. Статуи, а также можно спуститься на набережную Аниты Гарибальди

Piccolo parco di villa nobiliare, attualmente sede di museo purtroppo chiuso. Alberi di alto fusto nel viale che porta al giardino della villa con fontana. Da lì si scende ad una balconata sul mare, con vista su Portofino. Si risale per un vialetto alberato. Stato di manutenzione scadente, le mattonate sono da percorrere con attenzione in quanto dissestate. Posto tranquillo per la scarsità di bambini e cani. Parcheggio non facile da trovare, ma fermata dell'autobus 17 davanti all'ingresso. Non c' è nemmeno una fontanella per dissetarsi, tanto meno un servizio igienico.
Luogo molto suggestivo ma la villa necessita di una manutenzione
Very nice staff, modest collection well displayed
Una piacevole sorpresa,non lo avevo  mai visto. Ben allestito, ambiente accogliente e  opere interessanti. Issel , Guttuso, Gio Ponti...da vedere!
Collezione interessante presentazione migliorabile per luci ed altezze degli ambienti. Personale gentile
Una bellissima collezione, unica nel suo genere in tutta Italia
Il museo si basa sulle arti decorative e di propaganda del periodo 1880-1945, dall’Art Nouveau al Décò, dal Novecento al Razionalismo. Se siete a Nervi non potete non fare una visita a questo museo.
Great collection! Fabulous items, however there's few katana swords
I havent been to the museum, but the park of that museum is my favourite place in Genova. It has a beautiful waterfall

I had visited their official website and don't remember reading anything relevant to not accepting credit card for ticket purchase. I was denied entrance, since I didn't had any cash with me at that time. 

The woman there showed me a sign written in Italian, that mentioned the credit card denial. However, if you don't know Italian, then you can now know that, not that it would help, but just saying.

A great museum with stunning artifacts but if you're English speaking and interested in the historical background there is very little information and context available for English speaking visitors. Which was disappointing.

Wonderful museum that contains a huge collection of Japanese art objects and historical objects (swords, armours...). Very interesting. You have to enter from the "Valletta Di Negro" park  (Piazza Corvetto)

Great collection of sea creatures, astonishing  fish tanks, fascinating stories of Ocean explorations by princes of Monaco. Museum is very interactive and kids friendly. Each hour light and music show. Main theme is marine life preservation and ecology, which I liked much. Good themed gift shop.
Highly recommended.

We visited a few aquariums around the world (ex. Vancouver CA, Genoa IT, Bermuda, etc.) but this one is our favorite. Beautiful building, excellent expositions of amazing underwater world +interactive information in 3 languages. Interesting temporary exhibits. Recommend for adults and children all ages.

One of the best attractions in Monaco. Giant floor to wall aquarium. Filled with many types of fish. Very informative plaques and interactive boards and games to play. A must visit if you are in Monaco. And it is very reasonably priced

You can tell from the point on top of the rock and the building that it is a unique place. I really enjoyed a long morning inside the museum, from the fish tanks to the amazing view from the top. Take your time to gaze around or do your reading about the marine life, oceanography, and nature. It can surprise you with installations and projections.

Fantastic museum, very diverse collection and the presentation is great. Don't miss out on the light show and also visit the roof for some panoramic views. If you visit Monaco don't miss out on this museum.
Go with the guide until the end and the secret chamber. Well ok - secret wall, but still something ;p

This this church is tucked away and hidden amongst residential buildings just up from the old port. It has a very unassuming outside. However once you step inside you will be blown away by the architecture and the numerous paintings. Every alcove has numerous paintings sculptures from famous painters  and sculptors. It has one of the workers  of the church inside the building that is happy to tell you a little of the history. Well worth a trip to see.

A monastery with an amazing architecture and art.
It has five cloysters and a beautiful garden.
Must see!!
Free entrance and guide.
This is one of those churches where enthusiastic volunteers give you a tour through the church. A must visit while in Genoa.

Even though the façade might make it look not interesting, it is one of the most beautiful churches of Genova. It contains several frescos from the 15th and 16th century and volunteers can tell the history of the church and guide you through other interesting parts of it, including three beautiful cloisters with marvellous decorations.
Very traditional family osteria. Wonderful sea food and very very kind owner
Great food and service!

Ottima cena romantica. Servizio molto attento e curato, interessante la lista dei vini tutti a prezzi ragionevoli. Piatti di tradizione e rivisitati, lo chef si presenta ai clienti per riscontrare la soddisfazione e l'apptezzamento. A noi ha svelato un mezzo segreto sulla frittura delle acciughe da non perdere. Prezzi certamente in linea con la cena. Consigliato a chi vuole assaggiare un po' della Genova tradizionale nel centro storico a due passi dal porto e dal mercato del pesce.

Nascosto in un vicolo di piazza San Siro, il locale si presenta ordinato e confortevole.
Personale gentile, titolare premuroso e accogliente, spesso presente in sala a dispensare consigli o dar suggerimenti sui piatti del giorno.

Eravamo 3 persoNe, abbiamo preso 2 antipasti misti, 3 primi 2 dolci 1 bottiglia d'acqua e 1 di rosso dei colli di Luni ed abbiamo speso 67€.

Nel complesso, una buona esperienza

Bel locale, piccolo, curato e molto pulito con un menù vario ed interessante. La carta dei vini può fare invidia a ristoranti più ricercati. Ottima competenza da parte del proprio e del suo collaboratore. Tutto è curato e ricercato dall'antipasto al caffè.
Mia moglie ed io ci siamo stati per la prima volta ma, sicuramente non sarà l'ultima...e voi cosa aspettate?

Incredible hospitality and flavours, particularly the primi.  This is our last night in Italy after long stays in Rome and Venice, and after a series of disappointments this little enoteca won our hearts.

La Berlocca: che dire !  "ECCELLENTE" 
Un ristorantino accogliente,intimo con un cuoco come Luca è un cocktail perfetto !!!
Il locale è situato in un vicolo storico ben posizionato. 
La cucina tipica genovese e vini a scelta di ottima qualità .
Il pezzo forte ? tutto preparato al momento (ben curato) e da sottolineare tutto  SEMPRE FRESCO .
Bravo continua così .
Stefania

ottimo ristorantino nel centro storico di genova, cibo di elevata qualità. Abbiamo preso del pesce freschissimo nostrano, che ci è stato mostrato prima di finire in forno, veramente ottimo. prima abbiamo preso il brandacujun, un'antipasto di stoccafisso accompagnato da bruschette, e delle trenette fresche fatte da loro con gamberi e carciofi, da leccarsi i baffi. Buono il loro vino etichettato Berlocca, ottima anche la focaccia fatta sempre da loro. speso 70 € con amaro offerto. Bravi ragazzi.
Cibo ottimo... ma all' interno c'è troppo cattivo odore che rimane negli abiti. Servizio pessimo.
Buon servizio e cucina di buon livello
The food was amazing! Service was top notch and atmosphere great
The best food I've had in all my travels in Italy, the best service and atmosphere.
The best local cuisine in town and top notch service! Must visit when in Genova
wonderful food and place
The restaurant was beautiful.  The staff was friendly and quick.  The food was amazing!!!  I couldn't have asked for a better first meal in Italy!
